summary: Phoenix is a fierce comrade who rises from his ashes to set his foes ablaze. An element master, Phoenix bends the destructive power and illumination of fire to his will.
abilities: Blaze | Curveball | Hot Hands | Run It Back
lore: Phoenix's abilities are centered around fire. Being able to set himself on fire at will, Phoenix is also able to manipulate his flames to a degree to form 'constructs' which can affect the environment, such as walls or barriers of flame. It is unclear whether his 'flames' are actually fire (which would imply burning, and in turn, something that is being consumed as a fuel), or just a representation of incredible heat.

summary: Equipped with piercing Kunai blades, Jett can change the course of wind by rapidly engaging the battlefield and use the drafts to become elusive around every corner.
lore: Jett is often regarded as having a 'toxic' attitude towards people. She prefers to do things her own way, without relying on a team, and is greatly confident in her own abilities. Jett's immense self-confidence can come across as arrogance, and feel as if she is disregarding her comrade's safety, however her voice lines indicate that she is opening up to those around her. They suggest that she does care for her friends, but doesn't know how to show it.

summary: Having a specialty of oppressive mechanics and an arsenal of explosives, Raze is a chaos creator. Her ability to overwhelm zones and a keen interest to blow her foes up.
abilities: Boom Bot | Blast Pack | Paint Shells | Showstopper
lore: Raze has a personality reflecting her explosive and colourful playstyle, bringing happiness and positivity to the team. She often cracks bad jokes and lifts the teams spirit, all while obliterating the enemy with her kit. The rest of the team can find Raze annoying, however the way she lightens the atmosphere does not go unnoticed. Raze also loves to party and is always incorporating music and festival at any chance she can get.

summary: Chamber, a sentinel that “focuses on mechanical outplays” with an “additional focus on gunplay” for “an extra flourish,” has an arsenal of weapons at his disposal. He's handsome yet deadly.
abilities: Trademark | Headhunter | Rendezvous | Tour De Force
lore: Chamber is a radianite tech user who makes use of a pair of custom firearms, nanotechnology, and personal teleportation equipment. His general specialty is as both a weapons designer, and as a marksman, as before he joined the VALORANT PROTOCOL, he was in the French military, worked as a PMC marksman, and later transferred to Kingdom's weapon design department. The black business cards Chamber uses as part of his kit read 'Vincent Fabon / Chief Weapons Designer / Kingdom Defense Program', suggesting he was once lead of the department.

summary: Yoru is definitely the sneakiest agent out there while being one of the deadliest. He is the perfect choice for lurkers; considering his abilities to create fake noises and blinking out of the battlefield.
lore: Yoru's personality is reminiscent of the cool teenagers depicted in Asian entertainment medias. He is proud and arrogant, clearly exhibited by his frequent bragging and supreme confidence in his own skills. Yoru also lays a heavy focus on his appearance, and has a butterfly comb always close at hand. Alongside his pride in himself, Yoru is scornful to the enemy, and at times to his teammates as well. Yoru is by nature a Lone Wolf, a stranger to the notion of teamwork, and aversive to relying on and working with others.

summary: In a fast-paced game, having Neon join your party may just prove instrumental in settling rounds as quick as lightning. Her agility and ability to manuver obstacles makes her special.
abilities: Fast Lane | Relay Bolt | High Gear | Overdrive
lore: Neon is an ex Kingdom K-SEC worker, who encountered Chamber at one point in her life, and left with a negative outlook towards him. Later, Chamber sought out Neon to join the VALORANT PROTOCOL and she was recruited by Brimstone despite her and Chamber's sour history. It is evident that she is still in contact with her parents, however they do not know what the VALORANT PROTOCOL really is.

summary: Omen is an expert in concealing and traversing across locations to provide a positional advantage. Walking in the absence of light, he binds the enemy sight and tricks all while vanishing into thin air.
abilities: Shrouded Step | Paranoia | Dark Cover | From The Shadows
lore: The theme of critical elements of Omen's backstory and lore being 'unknown' is a recurring one, with several key plot points and events simply being missing or unclear, never fully described or explained. This seems to have been the general and intentional theme around Omen, with him being the 'mysterious and edgy' character, who's own amnesia mirrors our lack of knowledge about him.

summary: Reyna is a ferocious hunter after the hearts of her enemies. Her hunger for the life itself makes Reyna an incredible threat in single combats where she denies all eyes from sight.
lore: Reyna is proud and aggressive in her nature and speech. She takes what she wants, when she wants it, no matter who stands in her way. She has a distaste for technology and tech-users, considering Radiants to be decidedly superior, at times mocking the tech-users on her team. She is competitive, and often competes with the other Radiants to see who is the most powerful and skilled.

summary: Astra's skill set enables her to shape the battlefield to her convenience. While being a controller, she carries the aspects of an initiator by being able to control where her enemies go.
abilities: Gravity Wall | Nova Pulse | Nebula | Cosmic Divide
lore: Astra shows her care for her fellow agents through her jokes and serious concern while still focusing on the battle field. Astra's personality is bubbly and humorous, while still being unique to herself. Her attitude sometimes wanders towards mildly obsessive control bordering on perfectionism. According to a tweet from @valorant, this perfectionism is her primary character flaw.

summary: Breach is a literal ground-breaking cyborg, endowed with astonishing crowd control abilities that can shatter enemy ranks. His Faultline is a force to be reckoned with as he quakes the ground.
abilities: Aftershock | Flashpoint | Fault Line | Rolling Thunder
lore: Breach is a congenital amputee with artificial arms built by himself, with Raze implementing some major upgrades and custom work. Breach has implied his previous life was as a mercenary. His agent card and voice lines indicate that he is an experienced criminal who has various tricks up his sleeve.

summary: Already having birds-eye sight on his high-tech accessories, Brimstone can alter the way enemy movement with military-type airstrikes, vision blockers, thus conquering strategic areas.
abilities: Stim Beacon | Incendiary | Sky Smoke | Orbital Strike
lore: Brimstone has a very stubborn personality, acting as a 'father figure' for the group. Named the 'Old Dog' due to his age, he is treated as a leader and titled Commander and Captain by the other agents. He is in charge, in some part, of picking and hiring new agents to VP. Unlike Viper, Brimstone has a positive attitude regarding the youth in the team, and hiring new members.

summary: Cypher is a broker setting out traps granting or denying vision, impairing enemy rotations and collecting bits of data around every corner. Has incredible ability to gather confidential information.
abilities: Trapwire | Cyber Cage | Spycam | Neural Theft
lore: Although he is a dangerous and dark person, Cypher makes jokes and lightens up the atmosphere in the team. Many of his voice lines involve playing around with the rest of the VALORANT PROTOCOL, however Cypher can also be much more morbid, referring to the enemy team in a dark manner. Cypher also makes references to gambling, implying that he may have a history related to casinos.

summary: Fade, a Turkish-born initiator, is a recon character meant as a competitor for Sova. Haunt, one of her primary abilities, allows you to throw an orb that reveals the location of enemy agents.
lore: Fade's abilities are based on the enemy's fears and nightmares. However, she does also refer to the source of her powers as its own, separate entity, called 'The Nightmare' or just 'Nightmare'. In-game, her powers consist of moulding this into various useful forms, such as a Haunting Watcher which reveals enemies, or a Prowler which chases them down.

summary: Along with a flash, a temporary suspension of abilities within range, a molly, and an ultimate to stop all enemy abilities, save their ultimate, Valorant Kayo has defied all limits.
lore: KAY/O is a cybernetic from an alternate timeline several centuries in the future in which radiants and humans have gone to war. He was designed to kill Radiants using ability-suppressing polarized Radianite. The advanced AI is the 17th agent to join the VALORANT PROTOCOL. KAY/O has a definitive personality, even expressing sarcasm and humor in some voicelines. The robot enjoys 80's Synthwave music, and has mastered billiards.

summary: Due to her protective nature and her unique bond with life itself, Sage is a cool breeze that replenishes and relieves her comrades on the battlefield. Always keeps her cool.
abilities: Barrier | Slow Orb | Healing Orb | Resurrection
lore: Sage has a kind and compassionate personality, being referred to by some as almost 'mother-like'. While still pretty young, Sage exudes an inner wisdom of someone much older and more mature. She genuinely cares about the wellbeing of her allies, and places great emphasis on collaboration and combined victories.

summary: Killjoy secures the battlefield with ease using her arsenal of inventions. If the damage from her gear doesn't stop her enemies, her robots debuff will help. One of Valorant's geniuses.
lore: The focal point of Killjoy's personality is her incredible mind. She is without doubt the smartest Agent in the Protocol, a fact that she is very well aware of. This manifests itself in a strong confidence in herself and her intelligence, not without a fair share of bragging. She is proud and willful, with a high feeling of self-importance.

summary: Sova is a hunter who is capable of revealing his foes even around most intricate environments. Firing shockwaves that indicate the unseen, Sova allows powerful positioning to his team.
abilities: Owl Drone | Shock Bolt | Recon Bolt | Hunter's Fury
lore: Sova has a very calm and level-headed personality. Although he is incredibly dedicated and ruthless towards the enemies, he is warm towards his teammates, always encouraging and complimenting them. He believes in himself and he believes in his team to win. His steadiness and tirelessness on the field is most likely an asset to the morale of the team. He is here to protect his Earth.

summary: Skye is a mix of her peers; considering she can have an extra pair of eyes like Sova while flashing and stunning enemies like Breach. She is a guiding light into battle.
lore: Skye has a strong connection with plants and animals demonstrated through her trinkets and the drawings on her suit. This has earned her the title of eco-warrior and shaped her antagonistic view towards the Kingdom Corporation and their invasion of natural spaces. She uses her Radiant powers to animate wooden figures which she calls her pack. The pack is her company, as she usually works alone.

summary: An actual breathtaking biological weapon herself, Viper controls the respiratory aspect of anywhere she walks in. Setting her boundaries as a tactical area controller.
abilities: Poison Cloud | Snake Bite | Toxic Screen | Viper's Pit
lore: While once a brilliant scientist, she no longer thinks clearly, having become hateful and biased in her tests. Her personality reflects this through the passive-aggressiveness present in all her interactions and the resentment she feels towards others. Almost every Agent, at some point or the other, comments on her hate-driven mind.
